Posts.Content: I've been taking Zytiga for the past 5 months. I am stage 4 and was taking casodex previously. The Zytiga lowered my psa from 9.6 to 2.8 but it rose to 3.4 this month. It's supposed to be pretty effective for most men.
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3
Posts.Title: Advanced Stage (Stage 4) Prostrate Cancer

Posts.Content: If you use the VA they have a national contract with Elligard 3month injection. If your PC is service related then you won't have to pay anything. Mine isn't (blue water Navy is SOL) My co-pay was $11. When I was going to a civilian urologist the last injection I had from the thief was a 6 month Lupron and after insurance my part was $3400.00. That's when I enrolled in the Northern Arizona VA
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3

Has anyone purchased this from a local pharmacy (with a prescription) and took it to the doctor so he could inject it?? Talked to Walmart last night and their price was $1,200.

Posts.Title: Lupron Depot price shocker

Posts.Content: My first chemo treatment was two weeks ago. After having a port surgically planted in my chest, the doc started my treatment with docetaxel. Happy to say it hasn't been that bad. Stomach was a little qweesy sometimes during the two weeks but it goes away pretty quickly. Main side effect is fatigue but I can handle that. Today was a good day, practiced my golf game and plan on playing Sunday. So far so good.
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3
Posts.Title: Started Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by john4803 BAB, As you can see from my signature, I too, had 4+5 and + bladder margin, and 3 of 7 lymph nodes +, plus, but also + sv's and vas deferens. So far, I have had RALP, starting Lupron & Cassodex, following final path. After 3 months I am about to start RT, for 8 wks. to Pelvic bed and Pelvic and Periaortic Lymph Nodes. My RO, yesterday, recommended I do Chemo 2 weeks following RT. This surprised me because I had the advanced Axumin PET scan, showing no obvious mets. He is convinced, that with a 4+5 most likely I have microscopic mets beyond the Pelvic area and Chemo, combined with ADT is the new way to go. So, I meet with the MO on the 2/20/18 to discuss. Definitely not looking forward to Chemo. I noticed you had genetic testing done. Was that a factor in going with Chemo? In your case adding chemo early sounds like a REALLY good idea. It's not that bad and better now than later. Blast away with everything you have so it doesn't get a foothold. I wish I had done it that way.
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3

Posts.Title: Started Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Have done both a couple of times. Last go around was last month. The CT scan is a piece of cake. It goes really quick. They inject a contrasting agent but no big deal. The bone scan is a little different. They inject nuclear something and you come back a couple of hours later. The only inconvenience is laying still for about 10 minutes. I hate laying still but it isn't too bad. Not nearly as bad as a lengthy MRI. No worries! You can do it!
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3

Posts.Content: What a sinister looking package they send this in.Attachment 879

Posts.Title: New Meds Delivered Today

Posts.Content: In my prostate cancer adventure I've had both Lupron Depot and Elligard injections. Both do the same thing with hot flashes being the most noticeable side effect. When I was taking Lupron I was prescribed Megestrol for the hot flashes and it worked great. Elligard injections always felt like battery acid when injected. At least to me anyways. I can't take Megestrol anymore and they tried Venlafaxine. I took three doses of this and decided I would rather have hot flashes than take this stuff.
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3
Posts.Title: New here...looking for Lupron info. by those on it.

Posts.Content: For those who are interested I'm being treated at the VA with zytiga. I saw on my records the VA's cost on this drug. It was $3300.00 for a 30 day supply and a 3 month injection of Elligard was $125.
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3
Posts.Title: Zytiga and Radiation, safe?

Posts.Content: When to start chemo is the million dollar question. Sometimes a patient stays with the Urologist too long before an Oncologist is called in. Some doctors are reluctant to suggest chemo because of the side effects. As in everything else, some people handle treatments better than others. I'm two weeks after my first docetaxel treatment and I've felt fantastic the past 3 days. Only significant side effect I've had is fatigue. Good nutrition is crucial before and during these treatment. There are other chemos and oral chemos out there so try to stay positive and hope for the best.
Posts.Signature: PSA 27 at age 58 DaVinci 3-9-2011 Radiation 8-22-2011 Stage 1V 4-30-2016 Chemo docetaxel 1-19-2018 Radiation 12-20-2016 Orchiectomy 7-5-2017 Gleason 4+3

Posts.Title: Metastatic prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Psa is rising again. Went from 2.4 in June to 3.1 in August. Have been on Zytiga and Prednesone since December. Just wondering if anyone has any experience in what usually happens when the Zytiga stops working. What's next? I'm stage four with numerous metastisis' in the bones, mainly in the spine and hip bone. Had radiation last December on the hip bone and a vertebrae. Pain is gone but psa didn't drop.
